Email from them and our response. And no, Dianne has not seen this! I just typed that in!
From: Darlene Meadows
Sent: Thursday, December 4, 2025 2:43 PM
To: 'Aria Barjis' <aria@agricolalaw.com>; Dianne Davis <dianne@diannedavislaw.com>
Cc: Barbara Agricola <barbara@agricolalaw.com>; Su Jin Carpenter <suj@agricolalaw.com>; Maildrop Brittany Gilliland
<1f625a84d+matter1681760195@maildrop.clio.com>
Subject: RE: McGregor v. Gilliland Visitation Schedule
REPLY FROM DIANNE:
Holiday Visitation takes precedent over weekend visitation. Brittany’s weekends in November were the 7, 8, & 9, then 21, 22, & 23…Then it was her rotating
year for Thanksgiving. Her December weekends will be 5, 6, & 7, then her next weekend would be 19, 20, & 21 HOWEVER, Blaine’s Christmas is from 12-18-
2025 to Christmas Day (12-25) at 6:00, then Brittany has 12-25 at 6:00 until 1-1-2026 at 6:00 for her Christmas, then her weekend would be Jan 2, 3, 4.
ALSO, I understand Brittany did not bring Bennett’s eye drops back when she returned him home and he has been without them for 3 days. It is imperative
that she immediately return the eyedrops. This bottle cost over $100 and Blaine cannot just run get a re-fill.
Thanks,
Darlene Y Meadows
Legal Assistant to Dianne James Davis
107 Main Street
Alexander City, AL 35010
billing@diannedavislaw.com
dianne@diannedavislaw.com
256-392-3172
FAX 256-392-3578
From: Aria Barjis <aria@agricolalaw.com>
Sent: Thursday, December 4, 2025 1:32 PM
To: Dianne Davis <dianne@diannedavislaw.com>
Cc: Barbara Agricola <barbara@agricolalaw.com>; Su Jin Carpenter <suj@agricolalaw.com>; Darlene Meadows <billing@diannedavislaw.com>;
Maildrop Brittany Gilliland <1f625a84d+matter1681760195@maildrop.clio.com>
Subject: McGregor v. Gilliland Visitation Schedule
Good afternoon,
I understand there is a miscommunication regarding visitation for this weekend. As I understand it, Brittany had Bennett on Friday November 21 until Monday
November 24. She also then received Thanksgiving visitation on Wednesday November 26 until Sunday November 30. The holiday visitation period meant that
Blaine was not able to have Bennett for his weekend. Therefore, Blaine's weekend with Bennett should be this weekend. Brittany's weekend should be next weekend.
Please communicate this with Blaine so that there is no confusion, and that Brittany will pick up Bennett next week. Thank you.
Ariabel Barjis
Legal Assistant
Agricola Law

Darlene

To: Darlene Meadows <billing@diannedavislaw.com>

Brittany Gilliland <1f625a84d+matter1681760195@maildrop.clio.com>
Subject: Re: McGregor v. Gilliland Visitation Schedule
I understand. Brittany would like to have the visitation schedule align with when Bennett's stepsiblings have visitation as well. I will reach out to Brittany regarding
the eyedrops. Would Blaine be willing for Brittany to have visitation next week instead? That way her visitation weekends align with his stepsisters, similar to how
we did it over the summer. Please let me know.
[Quoted text hidden]
[Quoted text hidden]

Darlene

Blaine McGregor <blaine35010@gmail.com> Mon, Dec 8, 2025 at 9:32 AM
To: Darlene Meadows <billing@diannedavislaw.com>
I thought the decree stated noon too. Either way, I think that’s fair & she can pickup at noon. I wouldn’t like that if I was on the other side & I’ll be on the other side
next year.
Can you check one more time if Brittany wants the first half of Christmas break as she brought it up last night at dinner & I told her that we already offered her that
& she said she hadn’t seen any offers. Now as you know you just never know if she’s telling the truth.
Thanks,
Blaine
[Quoted text hidden]

suggest going by the Order.

Blaine McGregor <blaine35010@gmail.com> Mon, Dec 29, 2025 at 12:05 PM
To: Dianne Davis <dianne@diannedavislaw.com>
Hi Darlene,
Brittany picked up from my house on 12/25 at 12:15.
Bennett was having a very difficult time with the transition & didn’t want to leave with Brittany.
I asked Bradley if he minded taking a picture of Bennett, AK, & me on the front steps.
After our picture was done, I asked Brittany if she would like to get a picture with the kids, In which she did, I’ve attached it. Bennett was upset about leaving so I
said well we will all do pouty faces that’s why everybody’s frowning in the photo.
In an effort to try to make the transition better on Bennett I said, would you like to show your mom and Bradley your new gaming PC you got for Christmas. Bennett
said yes, Brittany and Bradley briefly came into my home walked into the playroom with us. Bennett showed him his gaming PC & I introduced Bradley to my Dad.
I then took Bennett outside to Brittany’s Car & made AK come.
I made a picture and picture frame of the kids for Brittany and Bradley that the kids gave them for Christmas. Brittany opened the gift. Told them thank you. (Kinda
like I’ve attached but without me in the photo)
I put Bennett and Brittany’s car gave him a hug as Addie Kate and Brittany We’re standing in the driveway talking.
When AK came inside, she told me her mom asked her if she was ever going to spend Christmas with her again. AK told her I’ve told you that I’m not ready & I
don’t know if I’ll ever be ready. I’ve told you that in order for us to even start to move forward & me to start to be able to build trust with you again that you have to
admit to what you’ve done.” It’s the first step..
I heard some of this conversation. I encouraged AK to go with her mother and after a few minutes said this is between you two. Brittany if you want to take her put
her in your car I’m going inside. I hope you and Bradley have a merry Christmas.
Before coming inside I did encourage AK to give Brittany a hug.
FYI -
She didn’t give AK a single thing for Christmas. Not a gift, Christmas card or anything.
I also took both Kids to Clanton last Sunday. Bennett attended Candlelight service with Brittany & I encouraged AK to stay as well.
Afterwards, we met in Prattville for Dinner with Brittany’s Dad so he could see AK for Christmas.
Let me know if you have any questions. Sorry I missed your call, I can call you this afternoon if you need me to.
Blaine
